theory: The Ocean's Dream Arc foreshadows future memory manipulation themes in One Piece, particularly with Big Mom's ability to extract memories and lifespan, and Pudding's Memory-Memory Fruit powers introduced much later in the series.
author: Various One Piece Community Members

theory: The Ocean's Dream Arc, despite being filler, provides important character development by showing how the crew would react without their shared memories, demonstrating that their bonds are deeper than just remembering their adventures together.
author: One Piece Analysis Community

theory: The Palace of the Sea God and the ancient writings Robin discovers could be connected to the Ancient Kingdom and Poneglyphs, suggesting that even in filler arcs, the anime tries to maintain consistency with the world-building established in the manga.
author: One Piece Lore Enthusiasts
